p: A map containing the number of deaths at the sub-state level due to hornet, wasps, and bee stings based on the twenty-year period studied (1999–2018) is shown in Figure 4. There are no registered deaths due to hornet, wasp, and bee stings in the communities of Navarra, La Rioja, Cantabria, Canary Islands, City of Ceuta, and City of Melilla. Furthermore, Aragón, Cataluña, Madrid, Murcia, and País Vasco only registered one death over the period studied. The deaths were more highly concentrated in the communities of Galicia (35.8%), Andalucía (21.7%), and Castilla y León (12.8%), with twenty-eight, seventeen, and ten victims, respectively.
